detaileddescription.para: Construct a new AmberFD force with the number of particles already known. This can help speed up the system creation for very large numbers of particles. More particles can be added than n_sites, but the memory will not be preallocated.

parameterdescription.para: the estimated number of particles to create a system for

detaileddescription.para: Add a new particle to the system with the properties specified in it's ParticleInfo
Set the indicies that define a fragment within the entire molecular system.
Get the number of particles in the system

Return the forces exerted on each particle. This will only have an effect if calc_energy_forces has been called forst with the updated positions. Else, this will return the forces most recently computed.
Compute the energy and forces on the AmberFD system at the current positions.
Get a pointer to the FlucDens force object being used

parameterdescription.para: create the force if it hasn't been created yet.

briefdescription.para: Get a pointer to the DispersionPauli force object being used.

parameterdescription.para: create the force if it hasn't been created yet.

briefdescription.para: Create a FlucDens force object. Adding particles to the system After creating this force will have no effect.

simplesect.para: std::shared_ptr<FlucDens> a pointer to the created force

briefdescription.para: Create a DispersionPauli force object. Adding particles to the system After creating this force will have no effect.

simplesect.para: std::shared_ptr<DispersionPauli> a pointer to the created force

briefdescription.para: Get the a mapping from the OpenMM particle index to the AmberFD particle index.
Calculate the interaction between a single pair of particles. Since Polarization is a many-body force, it will not be calculated here.

parameterdescription.para: The full array of positions of the system that would normally be passed to calc_energy_forces()

The index of the second particle

briefdescription.para: Get the distance object between two pairs of particles.

briefdescription.para: Turn on or off the use of periodic boundary conditions.

memberdef.argsstring: (const bool is_periodic, const double x, const double y, const double z)
memberdef.name: set_use_PBC

briefdescription.para: Turn on or off the use of periodic boundary conditions.
Determine of the periodic doundary contitions are used or not.
Serialize force FlucDens and DisperionPauli forces to a file.

parameterdescription.para: String of the file location to write data to.

briefdescription.para: Load in serialized data previously created with dump_to_file()

parameterdescription.para: String of the file location to load.

briefdescription.para: Set the number of threads to be used in force computations vis OpenMP. If set less than or equal to one, then a serial calculation will take place.
Get the cumulative wall time used to compute forces and energies so far.

detaileddescription.para: AmberFD is an umbrella function thatcombines FlucDens force and DispersionPauli force settings into one accessable class. This class does not calculate forces itslf, but is instead used create and access the fluctuating density and dispersion-pauli system and set it's options.

To use this class, first create an AmberFD object with the number of particles to be added to the system. The, add each particle to the system by calling add_particle(), passing in a ParticleInfo object. Once all particles have been added, create the fluctuating density force and dispersion-pauli force by calling create_fluc_dens_force() and create_disp_pauli_force(), respectively. Each of these forces will then be generated, and a pointer to each force can be obtained by calling get_fluc_dens_force() or get_disp_pauli_force().

Once the forces have been generated, adding new particles will have no effect on the system. Calling create_XXX_force() will simply return a pointer to the already created forces. If periodic boundary conditions are desired, then call set_use_PBC() after all particles have been added.
